greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T(i,j) read by antidiagonals, where T(i,j) is the j-th term whose binary expansion has i 1's.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8001
mathematica: a = {}; Do[ a = Append[a, Last[ Take[ Select[ Range[2^13], Count[ IntegerDigits[ #, 2], 1] == j & ], i - j]]], {i, 2, 12}, {j, 1, i - 1} ]; a
xref: The antidiagonals are read in the opposite direction from those in A066884.
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 30 2002
